medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain and fever following endometritis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after spontaneous vaginal delivery. The patient was diagnosed with endometritis one week ago, initially presenting with pelvic pain. She was treated with Augmentin for 6 days but experienced worsening abdominal pain, fever of 101.5Â°F, diarrhea, and nausea. A pelvic ultrasound and CT scan indicated concern for perforated appendicitis.
